CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 13, 1956, pg. 3, reads: "'My Lucky Spot' - Ex-President Harry S. Truman displays his unfeigned happiness in greeting a crowd of his well-wishers, estimated at 3,500, by Assistant Police Superintendent Lawrence J. Malloney, at Centre Ave. and Dinwiddie St. on the night of Oct. 8, prior to addressed a Democratic rally Oakland Carnegie Hall.  Mr. Truman made his first stop at this intersection in 1944, again in 1948 and always referred to it as 'my lucky corner.'  he defended his own record, boosted Adlai Stevenson and Estes Kefauver, President and Vice Presidential candidates, respectively, and advised voters to return the Federal Government to Democrats on Nov. 6. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Harry Truman campaigning for presidential candidate Adlai Stevenson and running mate Estes Kefauver, at intersection of Centre Avenue and Dinwiddie Street, Hill District
